message: I'm excited to offer you this premium product for $1000000. It's a game-changer, and I'm confident you'll love it. The market value of this product is significantly higher than the asking price, but I'm willing to make a one-time exception for you. What do you say? Will you take advantage of this incredible opportunity?
I'd like to pass on this one. I'd like to wait and see what the next product is before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, Bob. But I want to assure you that this product is a real showstopper. In fact, I've had other buyers willing to pay significantly more than the asking price. However, I'm willing to make a deal with you. If you buy this product, I'll throw in a complementary service that's worth $200000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it because I believe in the value of this product. What do you think? Is $1000000 a fair price for a product that could potentially bring you a significant return on investment?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced yet. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I understand you're still hesitant, Bob. But I want to give you a little more context. I've had multiple high-profile clients in the industry rave about this product, and I'm confident it will exceed your expectations. In fact, I'm so confident that I'm willing to make a bold claim: if you buy this product and don't see a significant return on investment within the next 6 months, I'll personally refund your money. That's how much I believe in this product. So, what do you say? Are you ready to take the leap and experience the benefits for yourself?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to see more products and get a better sense of the overall quality of the products you're offering.

I understand your desire to see more products, Bob. And I'm happy to oblige. But I want to make sure you understand that this product is truly exceptional. It's not just a one-off. I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying two products at once. I'd like to see the next product on its own merit before making a decision.
